metadata.title: CVE-2021-33656 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium
metadata.description:
When setting font with malicous data by ioctl cmd PIO_FONT,kernel willwrite memory out of bounds.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-33656` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

linux-image-5.4.0-125-generic - 5.4.0-125.141
linux-image-5.4.0-125-generic-lpae - 5.4.0-125.141
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-125-generic - 5.4.0-125.141
linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-125-lowlatency - 5.4.0-125.141
No subscription required

linux-image-unsigned-5.4.0-1074-kvm - 5.4.0-1074.79
No subscription required

criterions.comment: linux package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.4.0-125.141').
